page.title: 03Workers' Welfare, Bournville
page.content: When{George Cadbury}moved his factory from the city centre he was{motivated} not only by his need for a larger factory site but also{concern for his workers.}In 1879 he built the factory and{143 houses} which were the nucleus of Bournville, which has continued to grow. In 1898 33{Alms Houses}were built for retired workers. {Recreational facilities}next to the factory include a concert hall, swimming pool, cricket and football pitches, tennis courts as well as clubhouse for indoor pursuits. Within the factory complex a{shop}sells company products to workers at below retail prices. Employees have always been encouraged to improve their position within the Company and to aid this,{training courses}are provided to develop management skills at all levels. These are held at{The Beeches Management Training College}nearby.
